intro: Phebalium rude subsp. amblycarpum, commonly known as the rough phebalium, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, ribbed fruits. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
